alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 2:41PM PDT until August 01 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Nevada, including the following county, Elko. * WHEN...Until 430 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 238 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.7 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Mill Creek, Ditch Creek, Sheep Creek, Log Creek, North Fork Skull Creek, Jones Creek, Granite Creek, Little Salmon Creek, Merritt Creek, East Fork Skull Creek, Rain Creek, Thacker Slough, Indian Creek, Owyhee River, West Fork Slaughterhouse Creek, Skull Creek, Willis Creek, Salmon Creek, Fawn Creek and Slaughterhouse Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Owyhee and portions of SR-225 up to 12 miles southeast of Owyhee. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
